greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest common divisor of Product (p_i^e_i)-1 and Product (p_i^e_i)+1, when n = Product (p_i^e_i): a(n) = gcd(A047994(n), A034448(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..100000
formula: a(n) = gcd(A034448(n), A047994(n)), where A034448 is unitary sigma, and A047994 is unitary phi.
program: A034448(n) = { my(f=factor(n)); prod(k=1, #f~, 1+(f[k, 1]^f[k, 2])); }; \\ After code in A034448
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 15 2019
